fields.headline: Keane quits Ireland
fields.bodyText: Roy Keane has quit international football, dashing hopes of new manager Brian Kerr of persuading the Manchester United midfielder to play again for his country. Keane left the Republic's squad following an argument with then manager Mick McCarthy just before the World Cup in South Korea and Japan in the summer. Keane's club manager Alex Ferguson had urged the player to give up international football in order to prolong his domestic career. A Football Association of Ireland spokesman confirmed Keane's decision to quit. "The statement appears to have come from Manchester United. It's since been relayed on radio and television in Ireland."
